intro: Hibbertia expansa, commonly known as the broadleaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in regions such as South Australia and Western Australia. Hibbertia expansa has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
